doc:
Patricia Wright (actress) https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Patricia_Wright_(actress) 0 Patricia Wright (born July 15, 1921) is an American actress who made several film and television appearances throughout the 1950s and 1960s. Wright's film appearances include Chained for Life (1952), Trail Guide (1952), and Scandal Incorporated (1956). She also appeared in several American television shows, such as Gomer Pyle, U.S.M.C., and The Adventures of Kit Carson. Perhaps her best-known film role was as Lenore in the 1952 Three Stooges short subject Cuckoo on a Choo Choo.In addition to her film and television roles, Wright was also Los Angeles' first television weathergirl. She was also the announcer/spokeswoman for the 3M company in the late 1950s on the daytime television series Queen for a Day. Currently retired, Wright was the guest of honor at the 2008 Three Stooges Fan Club Meeting. Like past guests, Wright commented on how the Three Stooges films were produced at lightning speed, due to budgetary constraints. Patricia_Wright ( born July_15_,_1921 ) is an_American_actress who made several_film_and_television_appearances throughout the_1950s_and_1960s . Wright 's_film_appearances include Chained for Life (_1952_) , Trail_Guide_(_1952_) , and Scandal_Incorporated_(_1956_) . She also appeared in several_American_television_shows , such_as Gomer_Pyle , U.S.M.C. , and The_Adventures of Kit_Carson . Perhaps her_best-known_film_role was as Lenore in the_1952_Three_Stooges short_subject_Cuckoo on a_Choo_Choo.In_addition to her_film_and_television_roles , Wright was also Los_Angeles '_first_television_weathergirl . She was also the_announcer/spokeswoman for the_3M_company in the_late_1950s on the_daytime_television_series_Queen for a_Day . Currently retired , Wright was the_guest of honor at the_2008_Three_Stooges_Fan_Club Meeting . Like past_guests , Wright commented on how the_Three_Stooges_films were_produced at lightning_speed , due to budgetary_constraints .
